alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:01PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central San Diego County through 545 PM PDT... At 500 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley and Agua Caliente, or 9 miles northeast of Mount Laguna, moving north at 10 mph. Located in San Diego Deserts. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Borrego Springs, Mount Laguna, Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy S2 Vallecito Creek Rd, Ocotillo Wells, Hwy S2 Between Canebrake And Imperial County Line, Hwy S2 Between Agua Caliente And Canebrake, Fish Creek Wash, Shelter Valley, Canebrake, Ocotillo Wells Vehicular Rec Area, Agua Caliente, Manzanita Indian Reservation and La Posta Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains
